snippet.title: Jet Set Radio (Jet Grind Radio) Dreamcast Gameplay
snippet.description:
This video was brought in part by Sonic Retro and SEGAbits' look at the Dreamcast for it's 14th anniversary. Jet Set Radio is a revolutionary Dreamcast title that is brimming with style. It is the first game to make use of a graphical technique known as cel shading to give off an animated look to 3D characters. It also has an impressive soundtrack that works with licensed music as well as original songs produced by Hideki Naganuma. With it's presentation and unique gameplay, Jet Set Radio stands out as one of the key games in the Dreamcast's lineup.

This video was originally streamed on Twitch and progresses from the introduction up to the first Benten-Cho mission running on a real Dreamcast with VGA output. If you'd like to check out more videos like this, be sure to look through our Dreamcast video lineup as well as subscribe for more video content on SEGA Channel Retro. 

www.twitch.tv/vidyaretro/c/3003878&utm_campaign=archive_export&utm_source=vidyaretro&utm_medium=youtube
